results.title: Celebrations of people and place : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: The East Reservoir Neighbourhood Renewal was set up in 2006 when the area was identified as being in need and enabling residents to help create a community action plan. Part of this process has been to invite seven members of the community to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop to tell very personal stories the reflect life in the suburb.

results.title: Fire Woman and Tristan's Ascension: Bill Viola installation and interviews
results.brief_description:
This film captures the installation of the large projection screen and associated audio visual equipment needed to showcase Bill Viola’s works, ‘Fire Woman’ & ‘Tristan’s Ascension’. The exhibition took place at St Carthage’s Catholic Church in Parkville and the film features a short introduction by John Kaldor and interviews with Bill Viola and Father Michael Elligate.

Bill Viola has been instrumental in the establishment of video as a vital form of contemporary art. For over 40 years he has created videotapes, architectural video installations, sound environments, electronic music performances, flat panel video pieces and works for television broadcast. His video installations, total environments that envelop the viewer in image and sound, employ state-of-the-art technologies and are distinguished by their precision and direct simplicity.
results.title_for_label: Fire Woman and Tristan’s Ascension: Bill Viola installation and interviews

results.title: Fire Woman and Tristan's Ascension: Bill Viola opening night
results.brief_description:
On October 6th 2010, Father Michael Elligate of St Carthage’s Catholic Church in Parkville introduced John Kaldor and Bill Viola, formally launching the exhibition. Presented by ACMI along with Melbourne International Arts Festival and Kaldor Public Art Projects, the exhibition gave Melbourne audiences a unique chance to experience the work of one of the world’s more influential and important artists.

John Kaldor speaks of his admiration for Bill Viola’s work, and his contemporary use of the moving image, Bill in turn talks about his work, processes and inspirations.

Bill Viola has been instrumental in the establishment of video as a vital form of contemporary art. For over 40 years he has created videotapes, architectural video installations, sound environments, electronic music performances, flat panel video pieces and works for television broadcast. His video installations - total environments that envelop the viewer in image and sound - employ state-of-the-art technologies and are distinguished by their precision and direct simplicity.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Indigo
results.brief_description: Nine stories centred around three towns of Indigo Shire in northern Victoria: Yackandandah, Beechworth and Rutherglen. These films cover different aspects of the life of these towns. From local businesses to burning passions, the locals reflect on what they put in and what they get out of these rural centres.
results.title_for_label: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Indigo

results.title: Tell me a story (Canberra) : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: This compilation of eleven stories, created by Canberra locals, was the culmination of ACMI’s ‘Train the trainer’ workshops. The stories, mostly biographical, cover a wide range of topics but are mostly concerned with beloved family members and life changing events.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public express(February 2007)
results.brief_description: These eleven short stories were created as part of a Digital Storytelling workshop in February 2007. They mostly run for less than two minutes and cover diverse subject matter, including treasured family members, life changing events and vocational experiences.

results.title: Hidden treasure : thoughts about living with Turner's Syndrome : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description:
Turner’s Syndrome affects one in every 2000-2500 females. A genetic disorder due to the absence of an X chromosome, it usually leads to growth difficulties, infertility and, in some cases, learning difficulties, particularly with mathematics and spatial relationships.
These twelve stories are by those who have lived with Turner’s Syndrome, either by being diagnosed with it or caring for a child with the disorder. The inspiring stories are about living with Turner’s Syndrome and not letting it prevent them from living a normal life.
results.title_for_label: Hidden treasure : thoughts about living with Turner’s Syndrome : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: Western stories : expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Ayen Guinto, Charles Skoutariotis, Chris Villarroel, Dean Sacco, Katherine O'Neill, Krystal Webb, Laura O'Donnell, Maria Savarino, Marten McEachran, Paul Young, Samantha Sharp, Troy Maguire, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Twelve stories from people from Melbourne’s western suburbs, created at ACMI as part of ‘Western stories : Expressions for the future’ Digital Storytelling project. The participants talk about the things they love and, in doing so, highlight what it is about them that make them unique.
